Reviews.Title: “Very clean with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Hockey0808
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel to watch the Yankees/ Orioles game and to visit the Inner harbor. It was very convenient to Camden Yards, being only 2 blocks away and only a 15 minute walk to the harbor. The hotel itself was VERY clean and had what appeared to be a nice sports bar in the lobby. I did not get to visit the bar on this trip. The room was quiet, updated and had very comfortable beds. We ordered room service for a late dinner and the food and service was great! The entire staff was polite and professional! Now the negatives....the parking garage allowed easy access to the hotel but they slam you with a 26 dollar fee. You are given a stub that allows you to come and go as you please. The second problem is they charge you a fee to use the Internet. This is ridiculous! The third and last problem I had was that I had to leave the ballgame early because I have young kids. When I got back to the room, I found out that I could not watch the game in my room, as they do not provide local programing for the Orioles games. Horrible! Overall, enjoyed the stay and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights for a work conference during the week, so i don't know what it is like on the weekend. I must say though that this hotel has excellent service and the rooms are impeccable. Large clean rooms and a quiet nights sleep even though the hotel seemed to be full. Camden Yards where the Orioles play is just around the corner and it is a block away from the convention center. The only issue I have is the beds. They are TOO soft. I like a much firmer mattress. A co-worker told me that he wanted to take the closet door off and put it under the mattress in his room to firm it up. If you are visiting downtown Baltimore this is a great place to stay (if you like soft matresses).

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Inner Harbor - Go Birds!”
Reviews.Author: Graham G
Reviews.Content: Nice Marriott property located next to Camden Yards. I stayed here for 3 nights during the O's opening day Weekend (4/5-4/8). The hotel is very nice, rooms are clean, bathrooms have been updated (nice shower). My room had a nice view of downtown and if you looked closely you could even see the harbor. The property has a nice sports bar in the lobby but there are several good spots all within walking distance. There is also a Starbucks and Panera two blocks North for breakfast. Parking is pricey at $26.00 but hey it's the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to Baltimore Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: wannatravelnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this past weekend during a volleyball tournament at the Convention Center. Hotel was convenient to the convention center but was a little unnerving that we were greeted each evening with a homeless person begging for money by the door to the hotel. Rooms were fine, hotel was clean and nice although the cleaning staff did not clean some of the volleyball girls room for any of the three days we were there. However, the concierge was friendly and helpful in recommending a restaurant when most were booked and in helping us to get a large reservation. This hotel is much much better than the Days Inn Inner Harbor which we stayed at two years ago so I would stay again. But I do think the hotel should do a little more to make their guests feel safe in returning to the hotel and not being accosted by a homeless person. Also, one other complaint: pillows were either the giant decorative pillows or they were extremely small and mushy. Wasn't going to sleep on the big decorative pillows as I doubt they change those cases every night and the other pillows were much smaller than normal and extremely smushy so they were not comfortable to sleep on at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: librarian73
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here when visiting Baltimore. It is close to Cambden Yards Orioles Stadium and a short walk from the Inner Harbor area. It is clean, up-to-date in decor with a wonderful staff. We love the location and the price compared to the hotels closer to the Inner Harbor. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: zzrsteve
Reviews.Content: My room had two Queen beds with a little sitting area with a chair so it was plenty big. Nice flat screen TV with plenty of channels. Big plus was the hydraulic assisted door closure so there were no slamming doors to hear up and down the hallway. The WiFi worked pretty well. Good location right next to Camden Yards and a short walk to Lexington Market and Inner Harbor. I've stayed here many times and have had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with a friendly staff .”
Reviews.Author: Southerntraveler9
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this hotel across from the convention center . Was not disapointed . Clean , fairly quite and comfortable beds .

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: AtlTraveler152
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the walls are thin or what, but I had two different people in the room next door during my stay and in both cases I could hear their TV. The hotel was booked and I couldn't get a room change. Too pricey to have noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while in town for an interview at the University of Maryland Medical Center. I chose this property for the good reviews and proximity to the medical center and it did not disappoint. The hotel itself is extremely clean and decorated in a pleasant, modern style. The location is fantastic for anyone visiting the medical center, Camden Yards or M&T Bank Stadium. The room itself was very clean, the bed was wonderfully comfortable and on a high floor there was little to no street noise. The staff was always friendly and courteous and I enjoyed a lovely breakfast in the restaurant with freshly prepared eggs and plenty of healthy choices. Overall my stay was incredibly comfortable and I'd absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texasscout
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Baltimore and the lobby is quite beautiful. The service was great and the room was very clean. I will stay here again when in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tdoug12
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we were amazed. The cleanliness and decor were amazing. Hotel staff was very accommodating, friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was great. The bed was awesome, the best i've ever seen in a hotel. The restaurant was nice however the prices were ridiculous.. but there were several places to eat and shop at close by so it was ok. We would deff stay again and recommend to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: danielle F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we went to see the Baltimore Orioles play the Yankees!! The hotel was only a couple of blocks away from the field and a very short distance to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Baseball”
Reviews.Author: OmahaMiamiGuy
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with excellent concierge staff. You will not want to eat here, but that is ok because there are plenty of good restraunts within easy walking distance. Just ask Gene to make a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sam3255
Reviews.Content: We stopped in for a 2-night stay in Baltimore to be with relatives, not sight-see. Check-in went well but we had to walk through the lobby, outside in to the cold, through two locked doors to get to the elevator for our room. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. Hotel room was cleaned well during the stay. Neighborhood was fine but the rescue squad is across the street. We heard sirens before falling asleep but they didn't disturb us during the night. The hotel is a few blocks from the stadiums and the harbor, but a good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “If I was going to an O's game, I would stay here”
Reviews.Author: muff75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and children...my wife was attending a concert while the kids and I enjoyed Baltimore. This hotel has a great atmosphere. The lobby is beautiful, service was excellent throughout. My only concerns were with outside noise, which was somewhat excessive despite being in the city, and with a slightly uncomfortable bed. The bed had a small bow in it so that you always rolled to the middle. However, the proximity to inner harbor was nice, and there is a free bus that takes people to the other tourist areas in town.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Nassau, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, literally, it seems liked someone was always cleaning! Even the bathrooms during our conference were the cleanest I've ever seen. Staff were all wonderful. Within walking distance to stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, not what it use to be”
Reviews.Author: scooby-BTR
Reviews.Content: For lack of better words... the service stunk. Both the restaurant and the bar had the worst service I could ever remember. the restaurant staff.... , terrible,only exception would be the cook for the omelets in the morning. definitely not up to Marriott standards. I book about 5 rooms a year here for about a 3/4 night stay each. Have booked here for the past 5 years. might consider changing. whomever idea it was to change up the restaurant staff... maybe should be fired Room was clean, beds where as always, very comfy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for business & within walking distance of harbor”
Reviews.Author: SteveCDecatur
Reviews.Content: One night stay only (for business) but enjoyed it. Very clean, well-appointed, spacious, comfortable room. 4th floor -- not much of a view -- and did hear some street work noise (jackhammers) at 8:00 am but I was up already. You can also hear fire engines from nearby station, but noise did not keep me awake at night. Free newspapers in lobby but did not see any coffee. Ate in hotel bar in evening, and they had pretty good food and a nice wine list. If the weather is good, it's about 1+ mile walk to Fells Point area (at other end of harbor). Don't seem to be a lot of food options in 2-3 block radius of hotel. About 2 blocks from ballpark. Courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a conference and my room was comfortable and nice. There's nothing extraordinary about this place but it is a solid stay. My rate was $121 for the night. The concierge was very helpful in finding a place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Shorty519
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference .The location is great; just a short walk away from the restaurants and shops of the Inner Harbor. The rooms were decent and the beds were comfortable, and the hotel staff is really nice and helpful. There's a coffee shop on the main floor that serves Starbucks coffee, and there's a fitness area (I didn't use it, but several of my colleagues did). I spent a lot of my free time walking around downtown Baltimore. Overall, it was a nice place to stay and to have a business conference. I only have two complaints. One, the fan in my room just would not shut off (a/c, heat, whatever). Usually if the fan noise is bothering me I can just turn it off; with this one, no matter what I did it wouldn't stop. I went as far as looking for a cord so I could unplug the damn thing. I ended up having to use earplug to get to sleep for three nights in a row. I mentioned this to some other people attending the conference with me, and several of them mentioned this was an issue in their room as well. So if you're a light sleeper, bring earplugs! The only other complaint I have is that the meeting rooms in this hotel got extremely cold. I'm no stranger to conferences, so it was a surprise to have to wear my coat and scarf during conference sessions. Not sure if it's just the time of year, but it definitely made some of the meetings uncomfortable (and we had men getting cold too, so it was not just us warm-blooded women). So, nice place to stay, but pack earplugs and bring a coat if you're attending a conference here.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge is at the top of his game along with thehotel”
Reviews.Author: calgordon46
Reviews.Content: I had read some shakey reviews of this Marriott Hotel in Camden Yards so I was a bit aprhensive when our national confeence was booked at the hotel. Well, My misgivings were totally unfounded. This place is great. Gene, the Concierge, is the best. He reccomended just the right place for a quiet dinner and glass of wine. The rooms are wonderful and quiet, the beds are super. The staff is totally friendly and helpful. A wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bleh. Wish I hadn't stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: recklessweimie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate. The restaurants were adequate. My room was adequate. The amenities were adequate. But for $200 I expected more. I guess the most positive thing I can say is that it was convenient. And that there was nothing wrong with it. But there was also nothing right about it - nothing that made you smile, or feel happy about choosing the hotel. Maybe if their had been a game at Camden yards I would have felt differently. But the problem with the Inner Harbor, generally, was its lack of authenticity and this hotel could have been almost anywhere in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Right nest to Inner Harbor and Canden Yards”
Reviews.Author: MARKBUICK76
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night after being evacuated out of the outer Banks of N.C. due to hurricane Irene. Stopped in Baltomore on the way up to N.Y. to see the Yankees play the Orioles. Used priceline and got it for $79 a night. Check in was fast and friendly. The room was clean and appeared to be recently updated. The lacation was great. Walk to the inner harbor and then to camden Yards for the game. The only downside is parking was $24 a day, but I guess I would have had to pay for parking at the ballpark anyway. I would definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: jhu98
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from my stay here since this is an older hotel I hadn't heard any good hype about it. I was wrong in assuming that would mean average. The hotel is very clean, well-appointed and has a cute restaurant/bar aptly called "The Yard" upon entry. I like that it is also small feeling and that they serve complimentary cocktails (and breakfast?) in the mornings. Cute touch! The rooms were very new looking and must have just been renovated- they were well decorated. I had a wonderful view of the Bromo Seltzer tower from my roon. I would be happy to stay here again even though they don't have valet upon check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mattxwill
Reviews.Content: Me: Business traveler who stays weeks on end in hotels. Staff: Friendliest in Baltimore in my experience. Rooms: Nice clean rooms. Beds: Too soft. Many of my coworkers stay elsewhere because of this. Gym: In the basemen. Id say 3 out of 5 stars. The best gym is easily at the Hilton next door. Food: The bar food is very good. Concierge Lounge: The breakfast selection is decent. Easily better than the Hilton next door. The staff does an excellent job of keeping it stocked and ready. Internet: iBahn sucks at all Marriotts, and it sucks here too. Granted you can get a connection and it stays connected, but the speeds are pretty slow. Especially certain times of the evening when all the business travelers are online. Value: Good value overall of the better hotels near the inner harbor (see my other reviews), and I like Marriott rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KapitanJ
Reviews.Content: Always a solid stay. Very close to Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. Great small restaurants in the local area. Crab cakes at Lexington Market are super. Also, try out some of the food trucks in the local area. Great food and resonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “staff was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget101
Reviews.Content: this was a weekend getaway with a few friends.the front desk staff was knowledgable about the area and things to do! My only complaint in not about the hotel but i expected it to be a bit closer to the harbor

Reviews.Title: “we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelrochester2
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed the hotel, the bar and the restaurant. The hotel was clean, the employees friendly and helpful. The amgiance was very pleasant and the location of the hotel very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel. Very happy with it.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is solid. It's clean, convenient, accessible, well-located. The service was excellent, with great check in staff. The rooms aren't luxury rooms, but this hotel is not supposed to be a true luxury hotel. However, it's an excellent hotel, and it's very nice. The room temperature control was excellent. You can make your room icebox cold or sauna hot. Really critical for east coast weather. The beds are comfortable, maid service is prompt, and the room service meal was delicious. Overall, a very solid place, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Been to better Marriott Properties”
Reviews.Author: Barthy73
Reviews.Content: We "won" this property via Priceline. For the price we paid, I'm happy with the accommodations. The AC in our first room didn't work, and we drug our bags to the front desk for room reassignment after an hour of waiting for engineering, who we were assured twice "were on the way." After this initial annoyance, our new room was cool and in standard order. We had requested a king but were told they were all booked. As a Priceline reservation, we weren't terribly concerned. The $17 breakfast buffet was decent. Drinks in the bar were reasonable. The location of this property is very convenient. Less than 1 block to Camden Yards and just down the road from Ravens stadium. There are a few bars within walking distance. We highly recommend Pratt Street Ale House, about 1-1/2 blocks east on Pratt Street. As this hotel is on the Charm City Circulator route, transport to the Inner Harbor and other tourist locations was quite convenient. This hotel does not have a pool or hot tub which is a big drawback for a 4* property. $12.95/day internet access seems to be the standard, and the wireless signal wasn't great on the 6th floor. I could have hard-wired my connection, but the cord that was supposed to be in the closet was missing. If I paid full price for this hotel ($199+), I'd be a bit disappointed. For the $75 we paid, we were pleased but would have enjoyed a pool.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott is " Not A Lott"”
Reviews.Author: Surfmotelowner
Reviews.Content: After making reservations and agreeing to be billed $250.00 per night in the dead of winter to attended a conference, fly over 7 hours to be there, I live in California. Have to take a taxi because the hotel has not shuttle. Arrived and my reservation were WRONG, to fix it they wanted me to by extra for a sutie with a view, I refused and said it is your PROBLEM, get a manager out here. After 10 minutes, the manager found my room. In the business they call this a rent last room or screw your guest who makes a fuss. At 6am the next morning our room was shaking, the head board was comming offf the wall, after dialing 0 and Waiting 5 min for some one to pick up I said we have a problem, we because I was now awake and did not want to be. She asked what the problem was, I said can"t you hear it or yes I will send someone, never showed the sound went away. Later we found out that it AIR in the pipes. It only gets worse, in the lobby all of the Bell staff and Paid limo drivers were blocking the doors, you had to excuse your self to get by, remember it was dead of winter. That next evening some one gave out our room number to a guest in the hotel, they thought we were with a wedding party, This person almost broke down our door, I did not answer the door and they went away. None of the staff ever greeted us in a friendly manor, wait they never greeted us at all, lips must have been frozen. So sorry to say, but the Baltimore will be NO MORE if they do not make a change.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that we will use again!”
Reviews.Author: ppierce_57
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when sightseeing in Baltimore. It is walking distance from the Inner Harbor with its shops and restaurants. Camdon Yards, home of the Baltimore Orioles, is two blocks away and M&T Stadium, home of the Ravens, is a short distance away. The hotel itself is really nice. The rooms are very comfortable with alot of space. We will definitely stay here again when attending a game or just visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property in prime location!”
Reviews.Author: alouisemcg
Reviews.Content: I planned a convention for 300 people here and worked with the property over the course of two years. I did an initial visit for just one day in 2009, and stayed for a full 7 days in November 2010. I was extremely impressed with their entire staff, from upper management, to front desk, catering, and housekeeping. The concierge is very helpful and has lots of information on transportation (FREE bus line!), local shopping and restaurants. It is a 10 minute walk or 5 minute free bus ride to the Inner Harbor, which is lovely and has great shopping. You can go visit the Edgar Allan Poe memorial and grave just blocks away - on foot or there is ample street parking by the little cemetery and church. The property is also adjacent to the University of Maryland Medical Center, Baltimore Convention Center, and Camden Yards. My room was an executive suite, which i could have lived in comfortably for an extended period. It was very well laid out for business and/or pleasure. The property is very clean and up to date, as well as being well appointed with high-end amenities. There is a nice view of the Inner Harbor area via the wall of huge windows in each room. I loved the updated shower, but it must be noted that they do not have a bathtub, if that's your thing. The parking is a bit of a hassle - it is expensive and you have to arrange for in/out privileges. Not too bad for those accustomed to downtown city parking, but perhaps a hassle for others. The meeting space is excellent and conveniently in its own wings so as not to create traffic jams with the kitchen or sleeping rooms. The hospitality staff is EXCELLENT. I work all over the country in all types of meeting space and these people are in the upper echelon as far as training, expertise and people skills go. The food is very good - better than many other Marriotts in the same class. If you want something different, try Frank and Nic's West End Grill a half block away. You can't go wrong with any menu item, they are open late, and the staff is fun and efficient. If you feel like a happy hour that lasts an eternity and some regular pub fare, hit Pickles Pub just a block further away. I drank $1 Peronis for three hours there and met some fun people. I didn't have time or energy for the fitness center, but it looked brand new and state of the art, even if it was a little small. We had a great group rate that i negotiated, but their rack rate seems in line as well. Overall, this is a great property for the money and very convenient to many local attractions. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, WORST BEDS EVER”
Reviews.Author: BostonHannah
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference, so essentially, on someone else's dime. That said, the room rate still seemed high to me, especially given it was a conference rate. That aside... The hotel lobby is gorgeous, and the rooms are beautifully furnished and immaculate. I ate at the hotel restaurant/bar, which had phenomenal food for a hotel. The location is, as other's have said, about a mile from the actual inner harbour, but I didn't mind the walk and it's a nice one. I have two major complaints about this hotel. The first is that they nickle and dime you for everything, internet access, coffee, parking, etc. The second is that the beds here were possibly the worst I have slept on EVER in my entire life. It was like sleeping on a very very very porous sponge. I commented on the beds before my roommate got into his. He rolled his eyes and called me a drama queen. Then he went to bed. All I heard was "oh, wow!" as he sunk to the floor. So, all in all, I'd say find a better rate at a better hotel closer to the actual harbour but if you're stuck here for a conference, bring an aerobed. :) On the plus side, the fitness center was great, and better than comparable hotels I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: huchenjaeger
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern hotel, very friendly and competent staff, superb breakfast buffet with individual omlet preparation, spatious rooms, right next to the Orioles stadium. Definitely a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: keeptraveling01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located downtown and really is in walking distance of Camden Yards. It is located to plenty of fun restaurants and close to businesses if you are in town for work as I was. It is very clean and the beds are wonderful. I was on the conceriege floor where the lounge was great and the customer service was good too. The hotel itself was quiet which after a long day was appreicated. The overall customer service was tremendous. I will stay here again! One thing to keep in mind is that you have to pay to park which was the only downfall I found here. For the price per night, parking should be included.

Reviews.Title: “VERY close to Camden Yards and M&T Bank Stadium”
Reviews.Author: jackiepaddy
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the NCAA Mens Lacrosse Championships at M&T Bank Stadium. Great location for the stadium and Camden Yard. Directly across the street from Orioles Park. Good room with fridge. Nice bathroom. We had a great view of the park (room 640) and even though were the first room off the elevator, we had very little noise. Quiet room. Hotel was packed with lax fans but the elevators were pretty quick. Really wish they had queen size beds instead of full. Nice bedding. Flat screen tv with many plugs for chargers. Didn't use internet. Room service Saturday night was not good. Ordered burgers and crab cake sandwich at 9:45pm. At 11:15pm, we canceled the order and they didn't give us a hard time which tells me the order wasn't ready yet. There isn't much within a quick walking distance from the hotel for a late night dinner. Subway was closed! Jimmy John's sandwiches was open as was a nice seafood place and Pratt Street pub but an hour wait for a table that late. Large game crowd. There's a gentleman's club at the other corner so don't go toward Lombard Street when leaving the hotel. Sketchy crowd. Sports pub in the hotel did not have proper staffing Saturday night, especially for a holiday weekend with major sports event in town. But the breakfast buffet (not free) was very good. Our breakfast was comped because of the prior night's room service debacle AND the cold shower I enjoyed Sunday morning. Was the hotel nice? Yes. Was it worth $400/night? No way. I would return for maybe $150/night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent customer service, WONDERFUL beds!”
Reviews.Author: georgifisher
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Baltimore for a conference but ended up bringing along our 1 year old daughter. The hotel lobby was beautifully appointed and the bellmen were immediately attentive. Our room was a decent size and the bed was the best hotel bed that I ever slept in. We normally expect restless nights in hotels but were wonderfully surprised by how comfortable the room was. The location is central to everything and within walking distance to our conference center, as well as many of the local attractions and hangouts. We only had a few complaints - for the price that we paid for our hotel room, we would not expect to incur additional charges to use the business center. I had to print out paperwork to fax back to the office and had to pay $10 to access the internet for 5 minutes so that I could print off a few pieces of paper (which I was also charged for). If we're shelling out several hundred a night for a room we feel like there are some things that should be a given. Other than that, we do not have any complaints with this hotel. They met every request that we made and ensured that our stay was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: gene444
Reviews.Content: Just a note to express my thanks to your management and staff for making quality and excellence your primary focus. As this was my first visit to Baltimore and your hotel. Was there for a conference. "Bravo" for representing your city with professionalisim and style. EVERYTHING was excellent, from the facility, the food, the rooms, and your staff! Unfortunately, I couldn't bring my spouse with me on this trip, but WE WILL be back,...and we know where we'll be staying. Wish your local fire department could have located just a little further away, but hey,...it is what it is. Also wanted to give a "shout out" to a Miss "TARIKUA," one of the best servers at your "CAFE PROMENADE" I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. She is professional, courteous and friendly...and does it all with a genuine smile. You keep rocki'n Tarikua! WAAAYY thumbs up for the Baltimore Marriott Inner Harbor at Camden !!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stacey086
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here last weekend for a volleyball tournament in which my daughter was involved. Despite having a hotl completely full with teenage girls and Yankees fans, (they were in town playing the Orioles), all of the staff was exceptionally friendly. I was impressed by how the hotel catered to the volleyball players by having amenities specific to them. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. Good location too. The only bad part was the awful view of the roof from the second floor room we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, friendliest staff, close to all, secure, great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: dbochett
Reviews.Content: The purpose of this trip was to visit Loyola which was less than 10 miles away. Having stayed at the Inner Harbor area in the past we felt more at ease staying there than in an area of Baltimore that may not be as "good". Rates for hotels in the area run high so I went on Priceline and secured this hotel at a very attractive $70.00 per night. Checking in was a breeze. They honored my requested for double beds and allowed 3 in the room, no problem. Parking is $24.00 per DAY. Once the ticket has been validated by the front desk you are able to take the car in and out of the garage all day with no additional charge. The room was not the biggest Marriott hotel room I have been in, however we had 2 queen size beds, a desk with free wireless high speed internet, coffee service, flat screen tv etc. The beds were extremely comfortable, and not a bed bug in sight. (of course I checked, I'm from NY) Once we were settled in, we had no problem finding a cab to the Inner Harbor which is 10 blocks away. It was late afternoon, I have MS, and different legs at different times of day, lol, so we chose a cab. It was $5.00 with tip. Once there we were able to walk around the Harbor, and hopped another cab to Fells Point which took less than 10 minutes and $8.00 from the Inner Harbor. Fells Point was great. A bag piper was playing on the steps of town square to serenade people on and off the water taxis from the Inner Harbor. An Orioles double header had been in full swing, cheers and jeers bursting out of the bars as we walked by. Fells Point is a young, urban area, with a decidedly historic feel. Great little shops, restaurants, and bars galore. We hailed another cab back (legs) to the hotel to pick up my daughter who had been sleeping soundly behind our double locked doors AND the key card enabled locked glass doors that block entrance to the hotel rooms unless you have a key to that hallway! Nice touch Marriott! That cab ride was approx $10.00 for the longer ride to Camden Yards. Still reasonable! (My husband says he should have taken out the car...of course, Dear) Finally, we went back to the Inner Harbor for dinner at Phillips Restaurant for Crab Cakes etc. They were good. The service was great. My daughter was developing a sinus infection. Our server went out into the food court and BOUGHT her Tylenol with her own money. That was above and beyond and very much appreciated. Once we checked out this morning, enjoyed breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Actually, I did not want their breakfast buffet, but from the moment we walked in 3 people asked or suggested that we would be having the buffet. By the time the waitress came over to pour the coffee and hand us the menus, she said, " we have the breakfast buffet"....and I said "which I guess everyone wants us to choose vs ordering from the menu?" and she explained that you can't possibly get this much food for $17.50 anywhere, and it's so good. Guess what we ordered???? And you know what? I ordered 2 eggs over easy. And they were the best eggs I have had out ever. They had biscuts in a beef gravy...I can't begin to describe how delicious that was. My husband had french toast that I could smell as I walked up to the table. He ate every last bite. This was the kind of buffet you hope for but NEVER find. Well, now you know, it's at the Marriott Camden Yards!!!! Shhhh don't tell anyone... One last note, some other reviewers knocked the service at this hotel. That was not our experience at all. And let me tell you, I ask for directions everywhere, for everything. And I forget alot of things. Well, you get the picture. I come in contact with a lot of people. They were always very courteous, helpful, wrote directions for us more than once, printed tickets, arranged for wake up calls, and really extended themselves on every level. Bravo Camden Marriott! You clearly value your patrons and we value you! The bathroom was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Peak78
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nice property. Being a Platinum MR member, I've had the opportunity to see many Marriott properties that blow this one out of the water. I was attending a conference in Baltimore and attended several meetings in the seemingly brand new Hilton which is right across the street. The Hilton makes the Marriott look like a Days Inn. The property is just a bit tired compared to the Hilton and other full-service Marriott properties in which I've recently stayed. On the up side, the service was great. My room was cleaned twice daily - once during the day and every evening when I was out for dinner. It was as if they were waiting for me to leave and ran in to clean the room while I was gone. Very impressive. The food in the hotel was pretty good and the staff was super nice. The gentleman who checked me in remembered me by name five days later when I needed a key to my room. I was disappointed that I wasn't upgraded to a suite (picky, I know) but they were all contracted out to the convention. I'd stay there again if I was going to an Orioles game, but only because I'm so loyal to Marriott. If brand wasn't such a big deal to me, I'd be at the Hilton. Last thing, the "inner harbor" area with the aquarium, hard rock cafe, etc. is a good mile walk from this hotel. Not bad during the summer but it was a bit chilly in March. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sshrek
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip, and enjoyed it. The staff was very friedly and helpful throughout; in particular the concierge, whose restaurant recommendations were spot on. The hotel is located within walking distance of the conference centre, which was the main reason I picked it, and which was very convenient indeed. The room was nice and had all amenities you would expect from a hotel like this. My room on teh 9th floor was extremely quiet, which was great; although I am not sure, whether it is because the hotel is well build/designed, or whether I was just lucky with my neighbours... The only drawback was the charge of $12.95 per day for internet access in the room (there is free WiFi access in the lobby); however, it clearly says so on the hotel's webpage, so I was aware of this before booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: zeezai
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a couple of days, and picked this Marriott for its proximity to the Convention Center. In that respect, location is awesome - it was an easy five minute walk to the Convention Center, and for anyone who is there for a game - Camden Yards. I did not have time to walk to the Inner Harbor so I can't address that. The room was comfortable and clean, didn't have any complaints there. Service was pretty good and the staff was excellent. The doormen and bellhops were very friendly and helpful, greeted me at the door and helped me with my bags and were very helpful in recommending restaurants in the area. My only complaint was that when I checked out I had an internet fee tacked onto my bill when I didn't even have my laptop with me. Front desk staff took it off immediately, so no harm no foul. Also, they were courteous enough to extend my checkout time to 1pm. Overall, a good experience - would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grayce_The_Super_Cat
Reviews.Content: Rooms: The rooms have new bedding and the bed was comfortable also has a refigerator and individual coffee maker with to go cups, bath and body works soaps and shampoos. nice large flat screen tv with HBO. I was on the 7th floor and the room was very quiet. Short walk to food and harbour. Also a whole foods one mile away. About 20 minute ride from airport. The only negative on this hotel is the air freshner maids spray in room (so horrible could not get the smell out of my room) Would tell managment to not spray freshners in room b/c makes whole room smell like chemicals.

Reviews.Title: “no sleep for me”
Reviews.Author: barbiflys
Reviews.Content: The acoustics here are horrible. There is a party on the 2nd floor and the you can hear the bass beat all the way up to the 5th floor. It has been going on for 4 hours and there isn't anything mgmt can do about it--so no sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: joc9563
Reviews.Content: We were in Baltimore last weekend to attend a family wedding and stayed at the Marriott. Everyone who we encountered during our stay at the hotel was friendly and eager to help. I was especially impressed with the bellmen. While waiting for a cab outside the hotel with my husband, cousin, and his 95 year old mother, the bellman noticed that my aunt did not have gloves on and it was a very windy and chilly night. He reached into a desk and brought out a bag and handed her a new pair of gloves. That simple act of kindness left a lasting impression on everyone in our party!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ddcd1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless! Even the hallways smelled clean. The rooms and bathrooms were so clean; it was by far the cleanest hotel we ever stayed in. The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. Security and maintenance were less than friendly when we locked ourselves out of our room. Surely, it's not the first time this has happened, but they seemed bothered that they had to help. Being charged for parking where you stay seemed excessive, but perhaps that's the way it is all over Baltimore. Seems like they could cut their guests a break. I was shocked that a hotel of this size/reputation did not have free Wi-fi. We have stayed in MUCH smaller places that provided this service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Disapointment - Stay at any other downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Herring
Reviews.Content: If you look at my other posts you will see I am fair and highlight both the good and the “Needs Improvement” of each property. So when I say, STAY AWAY you can take it to the bank. I cannot say the service was bad at the Inner Harbor Marriott in Baltimore MD, because there simply was none. Service actually needs to be provided in order for it to be judged good or bad. The Hotel looks fine from the front and in the Lobby and the rooms are nice and roomy with nice furnishings but that is where the good stops and the nit-picky second rate property with uncaring Management starts. Valet parking after a long trip – no way, park it yourself in a tiny winding garage with undersized parking spaces. Bellman to help with the bags, nope, not at the Baltimore Marriott. Follow-through on the prepaid room? Nope, we can’t handle that here – Sir, if you see a double bill on your statement then let us know and we will take care of it. Oh, and by the way, we are going to put a hold on your debit card for the cost of the room + an additional $25 per night of your stay. Considering I booked three rooms this adds up fast and although not a lot of $ the chincy feel of all the extra add-on fees combined with the total lack of service makes me feel like I am at a “Roach Motel in the middle of nowhere just off exist 30”. Well at least I can put a bottle of water or soda in my mini fridge so that I will have cold drink waiting after my shower. Nope, there is no fridge at the inn. Call the Management and express my frustration? Fine just expect that the person you are speaking with will hang up on you. They did for me. When I called back, the person answering the phone did get the Manager to call me back but so what. He could have cared less. He prattled off some set of excuses / reason for the plethora of fees and shoddy service that was clearly either rehearsed or that had been repeated so many times it had become a monotonous speal that clearly stated “I do not care about you or your experience – we have your money, it is late and you are not going anywhere, and besides other hotels charge fees as well. I should have stayed at the Sheraton or the Hilton. At least they have a club floor where you can relax, get good service, and free internet in your room. When I asked what the difference was between the Holiday Inn and his hotel the manager made it clear that I had crossed the line. True, I just insulted the Holiday Inn. They have free internet and breakfast when you stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Just_Nini
Reviews.Content: We had used priceline and got a great deal for overnight stay at the Marriott at Camden Yards. For the price we got, it was definitely worth it. The hotel itself is about a 10 min walk to Inner Harbor. Hotel is very nice - staff is very courteous and friendly as well. One of the lights in the bathroom wasn't working so when we asked for a different room, the front desk was very quick to move us to another room. Bed was super comfy; had all the other normal amenities as well. Hotel parking is a bit more expensive though - so definitely use bestparking.com to find the best deal for parking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No internet connection at business center”
Reviews.Author: TheFranciscan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business travel and I needed to print an email. To my surprise, none of the 2 computers at the businesss center had a functioning connection to the internet. Also, the hotel charges $12.95 a day for a wireless internet connection at the room. THe hotel lobby is supposed to have free wi-fi, but not at all hours of the day. Otherwise the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cpmken
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (Sept. 18th). Everything was fine except we asked the front desk for a roll-away and were promised one but it never showed. Otherwise we enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: SandraFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Friday, Sept 3 - 6. I choose the Marriot based on proximity to Camden Yards as well as reviews I looked at online. My main complaint was the maid service. It was not good - at least for Marriott - my expectations were higher. The last full day - we didn't even get maid service - we had to go look for her. The room was fine and the bed divine - slept so well. I've never been crazy about the amenties. Some sort of citrus type smelly stuff. Yuck. However, you really couldn't ask for a better location for baseball unless you go to the Hyatt and my husband has always preferred the Marriott so that figured into our selection as well. I didn't care for or trust restaurant suggestions from the hotel staff. Was burned once for breakfast and almost again for dinner. The burger at the Yard lounge is excellent though. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Might be worth checking out a less expensive hotel that is perhaps a block or so further out. I did fall in love with the bedside lamps they have.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Convenience, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MindyLePooh
Reviews.Content: Central to everything - Camden Yards (baseball), convention center, Inner Harbor, Fell's Point (bit of a walk but doable). Light rail from BWI Airport just one block away - very convenient. There's a Hertz car rental office on the premises - another convenience. Typical Marriott chain look and feel. Comfortable bed, slept like a rock for two nights straight. Cleaning crew did an awesome job, even put orchids and chocolates on our bed for turn-down service. Not sure I'd agree with 25,000 points per night but since I have so many, it didn't seem all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Last Min Stay”
Reviews.Author: rebslo
Reviews.Content: Scored this room on priceline for $66 plus taxes on priceline the day before our trip. A 10 min walk to the inner harbour. Was allowed to check in early (noon) got a room upgrade (king suite) and had no issues. Paying for parking is standard in Baltimore for those who complained about the $24 charge. If you can find any hotel downtown that doesn't charge- write me! Room was comfortable, bed not as plush as I would like. I was right near firehouse and the noise didn't bother me. We actually had a guest open a fire door causing the alarms to sound and the hotel to evacuate. It took a good 10 min (you could walk in 20 seconds) for the fire truck to arrive making you wonder how long it would take for a real emergency. Concierge was very helpful and knowledgable about the city.

Reviews.Title: “First Priceline experience... great!”
Reviews.Author: jpepper197
Reviews.Content: I had a tradeshow to attend for 3 days at the convention center so I decided since it was my first time traveling without our dog that I would try out priceline. I got a steal on this hotel for $70 a night. It is just 2 blocks from the convention center which is great. Upon arrival I was informed that the king room I booked was sold out and they would be putting me in a room with 2 doubles. I of course explained that I was only one person and 2 beds was kind of silly, they did a little magic and I got an amazing garden suite instead. The room was huge, the view was great ( of camden yards) The only downfall was not the hotels fault, they are currently doing road work that starts at 7am which i did end up waking up to on the third day. I would stay here again if the price was that great!

Reviews.Title: “Average But Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for the weekend. The location is great for seeing games at Camden Yards and is close enough to walk to the Inner Harbor area and Lexington Market. The hotel itself is a bit dated and needs some all-around upgrades in the lobby area. The sports bar is a dull place with poor lighting and is in need of a thorough makeover. The gift shop-newstand-Starbucks combo is too small and cramped for a hotel of this size as is the lobby, almost claustrophobic. I would not be surprised if in two years the hotel is rebadged as a Ramada Inn as it is not one of the nicer Marriott properties I have stayed in. Staff is pleasant. The rooms, especially the bedding, are comfortable. Bathrooms have nice Bath and Body Works amenities. Plenty of hot water and good pressure in shower. Comfortable pillows and I slept well though hallway noise was sometimes an annoyance, but the hotel was crowded. A pool would have been a welcome addition as Baltimore swelters in the summer. Business Center was small and underwhelming. Best part of the stay was the $79 room rate I got on Priceline, which made it a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “If the price is right, I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Othello491
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Camden Yards for a weekend away, and over all, it was a pleasant place to stay. I used Priceline to book the room and paid $85 before taxes and about $100 after taxes. Considering that the Marriott was charging up to $250/night for that weekend, the Priceline deal was a steal. With that in mind, it's a great value at $85 but a poor one for $250. The room was a typical Marriott room with a nice bed, Bath & Body Works toiletries, and contemporary decor. As previous reviewers have said before, the walls are a little thin. Also, the housekeeping staff seems to have a habit of yelling at each other down the hall, and you can definitely hear them. The rest of the staff were friendly, so no complaints. The location is a short walk away from the Inner Harbor, the light rail, and across the street from Camden Yards. There's an on-site parking garage that charges a steep $24 a day. All in all, it was a good stay, but again, it would not be worth it to pay through the nose for a fairly average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for good service and a good value, you're in the wrong place!”
Reviews.Author: rufustehshinra
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, the hotel staff were incredibly rude to us. The front desk staff was very snappy, even over the simplest of questions. This is how they were our entire stay. For a hotel that wants over $200+ per night, their amenities suck. Sure, the beds are comfy and the overpriced food is okay, but no free wifi? Especially in the rooms where one can have privacy? That's incredibly stupid. They want $13 per computer PER NIGHT. We ended up having no wireless access the whole trip because there was no room to sit in the lobby - the only place that offers free internet. The parking is ridiculous too. At the price we paid, something like that should have been included and not an extra $24 a night in a parking garage that's messy and ugly with terrible elevators. The worst part about our stay? On our way home we stopped for the night at a Quality Inn in Breezewood, PA. For half the price per night we got a free, homemade breakfast, free WiFi IN OUR ROOM, more space in the room, a nicer bathroom, more comfortable beds, and incredibly customer service! So when you're in Baltimore, skip the Marriott! Any of the other hotels (even the terrible, horrible Sheraton) are way better; especially the Days Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Swervie
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from Camden Yards and about five blocks from the Inner Harbor. Staff was friendly and helpful. I didn't have any security problems, but the guards on duty by the elevators were inconsistent. I was asked to show my key only once in three days. The beds are comfy, the TV is large and has lots of channels, and the Bath and Body Works shampoo and hand cream, etc. are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Been here many times”
Reviews.Author: RHSBMF
Reviews.Content: I travel with my wife on business here once every 8 weeks or so and usually stay here if we want to stay close to the Inner Harbor. Parking is good compared to some other hotel in the area. It has it's on on site parking garage, that seems safe and well maintained. Rooms are average and hotel staff are OK but nothing special. You would think for as much as my wife and I stay there the staff would be more accommodating. Again I recommend but don't expect them to knock your socks off with service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jetfan20
Reviews.Content: Want to go to Camden Yards? Need a hotel? Pick this one. This hotel is great. Rooms are nice and the lobby is excellent. Very convienent hotel if your going to Camden Yards. About a 5 minute walk to the inner harbor but if you know where your going it should be safe. Inner Harbor is beautiful and so is Camden Yards. Breakfast was excellent. Overall an A+ hotel. No complaints at all, will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, unless you are concerned for your safety.”
Reviews.Author: ALTravellor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located too far from Inner Harbor and local attractions. The rooms are nice but are priced excessively at $220/night with parking ($25/night) and internet ($13/night) extra and there is no pool/spa for relaxation. Three nights there were individuals running the halls causing noise. The front desk indicated that they knew of the problem with non-guests slipping by security. Towards the end of our stay, we found soiled underwear and a 40oz bottle of beer filled with a yellow, foamy liquid (urine?) in the stairwell. We reported the incident. The night security supervisor indicated that they had identified the matter an hour earlier and that the matter was addressed. We indicated to her that we found the items just minutes before. At this time she began to argue (without provocation) asking, “What am I supposed to do?” before walking away. Management was notified. No action was taken. We attempted to move hotels but were politely informed that we would be charged the cancellation fee of one nights stay. This was not an option with expense accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Mariott hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpangratis
Reviews.Content: Solid business hotel that serves its purpose. Water with lemon in the lobby is a nice touch. WIFI in the lobby - no point in paying the one in the room. parking $24 for 24 hours, but then everywhere in Baltimore parking is not free. Professional front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you ignore the cost!”
Reviews.Author: Upp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, luxurious and has excellent amenities (microwave/fridge in rooms, fast wired Internet, free WiFi if you are close enough to the lobby, Starbucks in the lobby, free laundry rooms for guests, an excellent fitness room (with personal TVs and headsets) etc.). Luxurious linen and comfortable beds. Plush carpet. The staff was very courteous and professional. The rooms are very secure -- you can enter the hallways with guest rooms only if you have a key to a guest room. This is a nice touch given that you are close to center city. The location is convenient -- it is 1 block from the light rail at the convention center that will take you directly to BWI in about 20 mins. The hotel has a swimming pool, but it seems to have been closed. Do check with them if this is something you need. Only two issues: One, for this price, I would have expected a nice view of something other than the Hilton hotel to the south, the Holiday Inn to the north or the parking lot to the north west! Given that a few (about 4) blocks away, there is the beautiful Baltimore Inner Harbor, I may stay in a hotel near there for similar price and comfort but with a view! Secondly, if not for a view, why stay in this area? Why not near BWI and simply take the light rail to downtown. That would be easier in terms of parking as well. I did not try the restaurants in the hotel, but there are several nice eateries and reasonably healthy fast food places close by. Try the California Burrito on the next block for a quick, really spicy mexican burrito. Definitely recommend this hotel but for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great location- room OK”
Reviews.Author: hobber6
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights while attending Preakness. Excellent location if attending an Orioles game. Average room. The most comfortable bed ever, but small bathroom. Flat screen w/ no HD. Room service breakfast was very reasonable. Had a room right on Eutaw street across from the fire station and Bromo Seltzer Tower. If you are bothered by sirens, ask for a room on the other side away from Eutaw. $12.95 per day for wireless. Definitely not the friendliest bartenders/waitstaff in lobby bar. Food was OK in bar. Gift shop has Starbucks but the line was about 15 deep each day with one poor girl working shop and Starbucks. Several proms happening both nights, lobby was a crazy place w/ HS kids having fun. Being a Silver rewards member I expected more from a Marriott, especially the hot water situation, but again, you really can't beat the location for an Orioles game and bar hopping to follow. Props to the gentleman who hails the cabs/door/luggage assistance. At least he had a personality, they should make him a bartender/waiter... I would recommend based on location for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: miffyninja
Reviews.Content: i thought check in was at 3, but it was at 4. the nice front desk staffer let us check in early (the hotel was fully booked). you are greeted by staff offering caramel popcorn. the room was large, quiet, and clean. wall to wall windows for not a particularly interesting view, but you can see the stadium and bromo seltzer clock. you could get free wifi in the lobby, but we were feeling lazy and ponied up the $13 for the wifi. except, i'm not sure, it looked a like we were getting a signal from the holiday inn. so you may just want to randomly check and see if you're getting another signal before you pay. parking is $24 for 24 hours - that's a $1 an hour. as you drive around, you can see finding parking is a bit of a challenge, so this is peanuts compared to what you have to pay in other parking-challenged cities, like san francisco. the bed is insanely comfortable. you sort of sink into it and the pillows, so hard mattress people be warned. camden yards is about 5 minute walk away. you can reach the inner harbor in ten minutes, 15 if you're getting to the aquarium. the inner harbor is a hellish tourist trap, but the breezes are nice on a really hot day. federal hill is also just a short walk away; it's a beautiful, clean, safe neighborhood, making for a very pleasant stroll. 20 minutes got us to cross street where there are number of very loud, energetic bars.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joy_Upstate_NY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I expected for the price. Parking was expensive ($24 for just one night) and the staff was really rude. The rooms were nice but wifi is not included. It costs $13 a day to use and it is not wireless. The shower had nice water pressure but i wish there was a pool. Overall it wasn't bad but there are better hotels with less expensive rooms. I say keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “All-around great”
Reviews.Author: Dillicious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the blizzard of 2010 which cut our business trip short. Before arriving, we were a bit worried because we were scheduled for a 3 week stay and the rooms aren't listed with kitchenettes or even fridges, but the hotel accomodated us beautifully and provided fridges and microwaves in each room of my co-workers and me. The hotel was recently remodeled and is very clean and pretty. They also provided us with a continental breakfast which wasn't bad. They even attempted to provide entertainment during the snow storm with a free in room movie, a dj in the bar, and a great happy hour deal. The location isn't great, but the doormen are fabulous and will find a cab for you. Also, the Inner Harbor is within walking distance of a mile or so. I'm sure it's a fabulous location during baseball season. There is a pub around the corner called Pickles and it's the place to be! Some of my co-workers had complaints of being awoken by sirens because the fire department is across the street, so I recommend requesting a room on the opposite side of the hotel from the fire dept. I never heard a siren! Because of the snow, and lack of transportation, we were made to eat in the hotel bar many a night. The food was quite good, drinks were pricey, and the wait staff was HORRID. They basically ignored us and we had to track them down to get anything, and basically refill our own drinks. We didn't have many other options, so we lived through it and played trivia. The website said they have an indoor pool, but they do not. Other than the restaurant servers, the hotel staff was fabulous, the hotel was clean and comfortable, and it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: laurenjoshtravel116
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with Marriott bedding! We went to Baltimore for the weekend and this hotel was the perfect location. It was walking distance to everything. There is a Renaissance Marriott closer to the Inner Harbor that my family stayed at, however, their rooms weren't nearly as nice as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FuninPhx71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Marriott for a business conference and a day of leisure. The hotel was very nice and clean. You have in/out priviliges in the garage connected to the hotel,and it's $24/day. They give you an orange juice and a muffin upon arrival for the next morning, which is nice. The rooms were typical Marriott, but I did notice that I could hear the phone ringing in the rooms next to us, and the walls seemed to be a bit thin. Like another poster said, you do hear the fire engines at night. The breakfast buffet is the way to go if you are going to eat there - a regular breakfast runs about $15 and the buffet is $16, and they have egg and waffle stations, along with fruit, oatmeal, cereal, etc. We visited the Aquarium and on a nice day, the walk would be pleasant. It was very cold out, so we just walked back from the harbor through the convention center - it leads all the way back to the hotel across the street and you get some great views of Camden Yards. We had a snack at the bar and it was good, although they probably need additional wait staff. The staff was extremely friendly and I would stay there again based on them alone. All in all, if I was going on a leisure trip, I'd stay somewhere with a view of the harbor, but I would have no problem returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: retired605
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott rewards members and always try to stay at some type of Marriott when we travel. We stayed here the night before we attended a Ravens football game. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are super friendly. Our requests for a high floor and a refrigerator in the room were met with no problems. The room was spacious and very clean. We had a view of Camden Yards so that was nice. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Inner Harbor restaurants and the M&T Bank Stadium for the game. We had the buffet breakfast the next morning. The food was good and the price was reasonable ($16pp + tax) for the quantity of food available. On our next trip to Baltimore we will definitely stay at this Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “A nicer inner city Marriott”
Reviews.Author: unicorn123
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a convention in October. The palce is 2 blocks from the ball park, a good 15 minute walk to the convention center, and a good 30 minute walk to the ESPN Zone at the inner harbor, The staff was professional and attentitive. There is a sports bar therein with a number of TVs which makes for good Sunday football viewing. The rooms are what you would expect at a Marriott. I have only two complaints: 1- right next to a fire station and being in the city that means sirens more often that I'd like. 2- The bell men were overly agressive in my opinion. I'd think twice about staying here again due to the fire station, if same will not bother you- then I recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Khuntley
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was in a good location to the convention center and to Camden Yards. The hotel was average, The staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice at a Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: mnappi0606
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $85 /night via Priceline. They are doing construction during the day, which can be a little noisy at times, but during the day we were out anyway so we really didn't care all that much. The room was nice and the hotel had a relatively upscale feel. For $85 a night it was an amazing value. It is the GREATEST location if you want to be close to Camden. The hotel itself is nice. Its a little far from the Inner Harbor compared to some of the other hotels such as the Renaissance. However, the price was right and it was within the general area. We were very happy with our stay. If you want a nice hotel on a budget, this is the one for you. Parking was pricey though! All parking in Baltimore is...

Reviews.Title: “OMG !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joecool546
Reviews.Content: Had to take an emergency trip to Baltimore on Sept. 24th. My wifes brother had to have an emergency operation at UMMC. We arrived late and went to the Marriott without reservations. They gave us a discount due to the fact of the hospital. (we were staying through Sunday). They only had 2-double beds when we arrived, and they said they will call me if a room with a King bed was available the next day. (yeah right). To my surprise they called me on Friday to say they had a room with a King Bed. When I requested a refridgerator in the room, it was there in 20 minutes. These people were kind beyond belief from the Staff, waiters, attendants,food,etc. I will be making trips to Baltimore in the future and I will definately be staying at this Marriott (Eutaw St.).

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel walked out the front door and turned left and u were at Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Deltadog512
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel .. the only thing is they charge u $20 to park your car in their garage .. if u r a guest there it ought to be included . other than that very noce

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for baseball fans”
Reviews.Author: Liverneck
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip with 2 friends-75 dollars a night on priceline. People at the hotel were very nice and gave good advice. Went to see the Orioles and Camden Yards is a 5 minute walk. Did not try any hotel amenities....the pool has been closed for some time. the surrounding neighborhood is a little sketchy at night when there is no game, but that's not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Marriott Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlSd
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Inner Harbor Marriott at Camden Yards for 3 days in July. We attended a conference at the Marriott and received nothing but excellent service throughout our entire stay. Everyone from the doorman to the desk clerks were very helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to say hello and ask how our day was. I have heard east coast customer service can be lacking at times, but we didn't find this to be true at all. The only thing lacking was the concierge-he or she wasn't present througout most of our trip. But the other staff went out of their way to answer our questions and assist us whenever possible. Our room was nice and the food catered for the conference was excellent. It is within walking distance (6-7 blocks) to the Inner Harbor, which was lovely. There was live music/entertainment most nights and we had a great time at a little Irish pub at the Inner Harbor called Tir Na Nog. I've never been a big fan of Marriotts in general, but I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with a luxurious feel and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Fraggler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst attending a NASRO conference at the nearby Hilton, the Hilton had better facilities and views but the feel at the Marriott was undoubtedly better. The staff were far more curteous and went out of their way to be helpful. I prefer the style of lobby at the Marriott as it appears more welcoming. The room was well equipped and clean. The internet service was as always pricey but worked well and was reasonably fast. Only ate at the hotel a couple of times but the food was of a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: mln304
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on July 4 weekend - got a great deal at last minute through Priceline. This hotel is about 1 block from Camden Yard & about 4 blocks from Inner Harbor. Parking in hotel parking lot was $24/day. They no longer have a pool. The room was nice, clean with a good sized bathroom. The best part for me was the really comfortable bed & pillows. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant - only got bagels & muffins in the little gift shop. I was disappointed with the fireworks at the Inner Harbor on July 4 - they seemed so far away & weren't that great. Had dinner at Pratt Street Ale House about 2 blocks from hotel - had live music outside in evening & decent food. Also had dinner in Little Italy at a place called Amicci's which was a nice, casual little place with good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee76
Reviews.Content: Went to Baltimore for a wedding and stayed at this hotel. It was very nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge didn't seem all too knowledgeable, though. Our room was very warm, so they changed us to another room. It didn't have as nice of a view but at least it was cooler. The restaurant was good. Water taxi is right outside the hotel, which is very convenient. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay; great location”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: Where's the first place most folks go when they walk into their room? The bathroom! I was greeted with old urine on the toilet seat, hair on the floor, moldy shower tile and dirty tile floor grout. Additionally, anything that was silver, like the toilet paper holder, hadn't seen a dusting in a while. Other than the bathroom, the room was fine. Well appointed with an awesome flat screen tv. Mushy bed (I like mine a little firmer), but it was fine. Disappointed in $13/day wi-fi access - could not pick up any other signals. Free wi-fi was available in the lobby. Was able to grab a quick bite at their psuedo-Starbucks cafe in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, this is NOT a standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The promo material bills this hotel as a full Marriott. I might accept it as a Courtyard, but no way does it approach full Marriott quality. The fitness area is small, and the pool appears permanently closed. No pool, no hot tub ... those are simply automatic amenities with a full Marriott, and this hotel doesn't have them. (Some staff believes the pool may reopen, others have heard it's being remodeled into banquet space.) The restaurant and room service prices are at least as high as a full Marriott in a top-tier city, and the $12.95/night Internet and the parking fees (I believe $25) are heavy duty. But the rooms are small, the climate control is a noisy Ramada-style wall unit that's controlled by a thermostat, the mini-bar had apparently been disabled (handle gone, door glued shut) ... but it east half of the dresser space, so there's very little storage (at least in sixth-floor rooms). A wall socket was apparently spliced to fit a bump-out in the wall, so the face place is about two-thirds as wide as normal, with a rough-cut edge down one side. Is that big stuff? No, but again - it's simply not Marriott quality. Gene the concierge is beyond outstanding - if you go, you really want to say hello. He's cheerful and upbeat, as are a couple of the doormen and at least one of the desk clerks. But most of the desk staff we encountered was bored/brusque, and the check-in clerk was way, way more interested in confirming whether I was a Marriott rewards member than in answering questions about the hotel. Clearly, this hotel gets a lot of business from the ballpark, and I'm guessing there's a disproportionate percentage of children/familes/budget travelers compared to a regular Marriott. That may explain why this hotel SHOUL D be a Courtyard (and priced as a Courtyard), but it doesn't explain putting the full Marriott brand on a substandard product.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Niagarax
Reviews.Content: A typical Marriott. Two queen beds could accomodate three adults. The restaurant was good for breakfast. Right downtown.The area around felt safe enough. The parking charges were high.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel for Inner Harbor Area”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip2009Ma
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews and found that our stay was excellent. The room seemed refurbished and clean. The staff was helpful; the beds comfortable and the restaurant very good (had both dinner and buffet breakfast there). 2 mins from Camden Yard. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Conventions”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Marriott Inner Harbor since it is only 2 blocks from the Convention Center. Got a great rate so my room was pretty small but still just fine for what I needed. I requested an upgrade at check in and received the concierge lounge access. That was very nice since the drinks are fairly reasonable, a very nice breakfast and hor d'oeuvres and desserts are great! Too bad the lounge is not open Friday night to Sunday morning but I used it all the other days I was there morning and evening and loved it. Service there was wonderful. The main restaurant was closed due to low capacity except for breakfast. I went for the buffet one morning and it was not really all that good for the price. I chose to order room service for breakfast and it was better than the restaurant and cheaper too! They do have a laundry on two floors also it you want to wash your own laundry for a couple bucks! Hotel is very nice, clean, friendly and nicely layed out. Nice restaurants located nearby. Went to Harborplace for Seafood which was very good. Babalu Grill, which is latin is great if you like that type of food. Work out area is just ok but pool has been closed. Free internet access is in the concierge lounge but business center charges $5.00 for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeam
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal thru priceline on a one night stay. The only staff we really dealt with were the front desk and they were wonderful. The room was clean, well furnished and the bed was very comfortable. About a 10 minte walk to the Inner Harbor. A very pleasant visit and I would stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline for 80 all inclusive. Check in was very friendly and attentive, with a smile. The location is great for anyone into baseball and football, as it is in walking distance to both stadiums. The building is an ugly 1970s structure which pales in front of the Hilton in front. The room was ample although I was given a room with a view on the back of the building. The king bed was very comfortable, with again a LCD TV. The work station is kind of awkward, with very little place to put a laptop. Internet connection is around 12$. The bathroom is large and well supplied. The restaurant in the hotel is typically expensive, but there is not much in terms of places for breakfast...I wouldn't try that greasy spoon next to the strip joint. It is close to the Wharf Rat, if you want a good beer. The gym is well equipped, however the pool is smallish and claustrophobic. Overall, enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel ~ No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: ljk73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve with good expectations. The hotel was beautiful and well-staffed. The check-in was smooth and pleasant. The room and the bedding was very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the flat panel tv was nice. We even had a pretty decent view. We were very pleased until it came time to get ready to go out for the evening. My husband discovered that there was no hot water. He called the front desk and they informed him that the engineers were working on it. The next morning when it was time to shower, we discovered that there was still no hot water. My husband called the front desk and was told, yes, there was no hot water. The inability to bathe is really not something we expected to deal with. It is rather surprising that the hotel staff didn't find it absurd. They never offered to move us to a different room the night before. Apparently, they knew that not all floors/rooms were affected. My husband was very displeased and voiced his feelings when we checked out. In consideration, they credited us the $24 parking fee and gave us 15,000 reward points. It's a shame, because this is a very nice hotel, but the lack of hot water, and the staff's seeming lack of concern about it is why I can't give it better marks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: cv529
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as close to Camden Yard as you can possibly get. My 9 yr old son and I were in town for the Orioles-Yankees ball game. We were in the hotel restaurant snacking and killing time before heading over to the game. My son mentioned to our waiter that he was interested in being a chef. The waiter must have mentioned that to the chef because he came out, introduced himself, gave my son a tour of his kitchen, answered his questions and brought him am amazing chocolate cake and ice cream dessert. For that reason alone I will always stay here while in town. Great customer service is what truly makes a hotel stay a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Check the beds!! And OMG NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: travelingman_Gene
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a whirlwind trip from MA to SC and back. didn't want to drive the straight 16 so we did a mini vaca on the way down in Washington DC and on the way back in Baltimore. When we landed the inner harbor next to camden yards, we were so excited. Well, then ended really quick. When we went to check in we had a very passive-aggressive front desk member. Who quickly noted those who book on the Net have no choice in bedding or location of room, we simply requested a king not near the elevators, we wantted quiet. We got neither. Placed by an electrical room, that when we woke up, had seven men in that "closet" working on smoke alarms with Freon. One whistling loudly, the others talking with no care for the DND sign on our door literally inches away. The bedding had to be replaced twice before we got clean sheets.
