It was so bad it was the first thing we requested upon arrival. Eww! One of the elevators were out of service and oh yeah.. this hotel has no room with a view. The only staff worth a lick of salt was the general lobby staff, bellhop, lobby manager, etc... All others forget about it. Nuf said.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: DJHillsdon
Reviews.Content: Want to talk about the economy hurting? We landed this hotel for $88/night via Priceline and it was the night BEFORE a huge football game a few blocks away. Regardless, this hotel had everything. I would have paid more than double what I spent and still had written this same review. Staff was friendly, lobby was beautiful, location is fantastic (across the street from Camden Yards and 2 blocks from the football stadium; 2 blocks from the Convention Center and 4 blocks from the Inner Harbor). Rooms were great size, very clean & very modern (recently rennovated maybe?). Overall fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun overnight trip”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrkker
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is perfectly situated a block from the ballparks, and a few blocks from the inner harbor, not far to walk to Little Italy, a 20 minute drive from the airport. Many things to do and see in this area. The hotel itself was clean and very comfortable. The beds are great. Not the largest rooms, but very well furnished. Watched some football in the sports bar. Very accommodating staff. Fair prices on drinks and appetizers. Spent the afternoon walking around the inner harbour. There are paddle boat rentals available from $10 per half hour. Fun to do on a nice day. Plenty of restaurants in this area. The Aquarium is right there as well. Great hotel, great location. A perfect place for a relaxed but eventful day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location To Ball Parks & Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: sunny45
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night on Priceline for $68 just for a quick weekend getaway to go to the Inner Harbor. Was very pleased with the accommodations. The front desk staff was extremely friendly. We arrived several hours before the designated check in time and they let us check in with no problem. The room was large and spotless. Bed was comfortable. Room had a plasm TV which seems to the norm these days in most hotels we have been staying in. The lobby was really beautiful. We didn't have time to use the pool or exercise facilities but did go and check them out and they were really nice. I would hope to get this hotel again if I could next time bidding on Priceline. We spent most of our time touring the Inner Harbor and there was a baseball game that night so we went to Camden Yards for that and it was just a few blocks away. Awesome stadium!!! We ate at a place called the Wharf Rat right around the corner from the hotel with great food and a nice pub atmosphere specializing in it's own brew called "Oliver Ale". They have another location at the Inner Harbor as well. Of course, we went to the aquarium which is always a blast. Location to both the football and baseball stadiums is perfect and the walk to the Inner Harbor is just a few blocks further but not far at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if Going to the Game”
Reviews.Author: mtf523
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great area for us since the focus of our trip was to see a few Orioles games. It was very convenient to walk 2 blocks and be at the ballpark. The room itself was very nice and the bed was very comfortable (Marriott has started something similar to the Westin with their Heavenly Beds). Those were the positives. When we checked in, we were told there were no more two double bed rooms which was what we were guaranteed since there were 4 of us. We were told that a roll away bed would be right up along with pillows, sheets, etc. 7 hours later and no delivery to our room, we were told there were no more left! Fortunately we got upgraded to a 1 BR suite but not until midnight with two exhausted little boys. Things went much more smoothly after that but it was a rough first day. Note: the next morning we saw a truckload of roll away beds being delivered so hopefully they now have extras. The hotel was packed and it didn't seem like there were enough elevators to accommodate everyone (one was actually broken all weekend). The wait sometimes took over 5 minutes. People would overcrowd the elevators because they were tired of waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Marriott Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: SFSCOTLAND
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for a 4 day Convention at the Baltimore Convention Center. Rooms have been completely remodeled - new carpet, wall paper and paint job. Flat screen TV's in all rooms. Very Clean and service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at Camden, good location but not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: lvangrin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott at Camden Yards and came away disappointed with the experience. The good news is the location was great for getting to the ballpark and the harbor. The bad news is that inspite of extensive remodeling this hotel has problems. Our room was nicely remodeled and looked great, but the air conditioning unit didn't work. When I called to complain they sent up 2 maintenance guys who quickly determined they had found the problem and spent 45 minutes fixing it. We left to go to the ballgame and when we came back it was just as hot. When I called down to the front desk to complain they only offered to send maintenance up again. I said how about you find me another room to move to instead. They did agree to move us to a new room and at 10:30 pm we moved all our stuff. The staff didn't offer any apologies or reduction in our room rate. I was also disappointed that the beds were doubles and not queens.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: alpha03
Reviews.Content: The marriot did not dissapoint. Parking and unloading were simple...Check in went smoothly and they were kind about early check-in without notice. A nice young woman from the netherlands checked us in and was very accomodating. As in most marriots the bed was wonderful....The location was great ! Camden Yards is across the street and you are just 5 minutes walking from the inner harbor. No complaints at all...

Reviews.Title: “Great Inner Harbor Location”
Reviews.Author: subdave
Reviews.Content: Above average digs and perfect location for the convention center. Big plus was the ION water filter system at the health club for drinking water, and the adequate pool in the basement where I watched the Celtics and Pistons after a swim while peddling a stationery bike in a much-too-tight Speedo (as Sam Kinison used to say, thanks for the visual)! Bedding and LCD TV added to the comfortable surroundings. Who cares if one gets a beautiful view of the adjoining parking structure? Any woman, that's who! For guys, forget about it! Lobby was spacious as well as the bar restaurant combo. One could not ask for a better abode for only $70 plus taxes at a three star hotel in the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Goldielou
Reviews.Content: Close to Camden Yards. Easy walk to Inner Harbor. The room was large, the bed comfortable, nice climate control. Our room had a view of the "Bromo Setlzer" tower; a view now blocked from Camden Yards by the new Hilton being built .(boo!) We got a good room rate, so I was happy with the experience. We were able to leave the car in the parking garage after check out. I did not notice much city noise, and our room also looked out over a fire station. The only negative was TV noise from the adjacent room. This hotel is close to Old Otterbein Church--Sunday service is at 11:00 and well worth a visit. I have walked past that church for 14 years going and coming to Orioles games and never took the time to attend. The building is beautiful and the congregation very welcoming. Their sign says "come as you are". They really mean it. As for the hotel, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Durango4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for business while I exhibited at a convention. I have stayed here twice before, so I know a little about what to expect. 1. Getting my room on a crowded weekend, took longer than expected. Got to the hotel around 12:30. Still at 4:00 the room was not ready. The manager put me on the floor where you get conceriege happy hour and breakfast at no charge. I assume this was to make up for my wait and because I did not make a fuss about the delay. My overall rating on getting to my room would be a B+. 2. Room was very clean and everything worked and looked very freshened. Rating A+ 3. Had lunch at the in house resteraunt. Food was good, but the service was very lacking. Very slow service and checking on the customer to see if they needed anything, was almost non-existant. Rating C 4. Location to convention center (my main reason to be there) is walking distance. It is also close to Camden Yards and the Wharf area. Rating A Overall I will give this stay a B+. Could have been worse, but the things that truely mattered to me, (clean room) were in top order.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close”
Reviews.Author: sac26
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Oriole's - Yankee game over the weekend and had a very nice, clean room on the third floor. The room was smaller than other Marriott's we've stayed at, but clean is what counts. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the water - perfect considering how crowded and noisy the harbor area can be. The staff were very nice and the housekeeping checked in on us the first day to ensure that we had everything we needed. If you go for a baseball game this is also a perfect spot - Camden Yards is literally across the street. Overall a great time - the only bummer was that the service in nearly every restaurant was poor. The Wharf Rat was the best of them all. La Tasca the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews Not Warranted”
Reviews.Author: cmak12
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe the negative reviews regarding this property. We experienced hardly any of the problems mentioned in previous reviews. We went to Baltimore this weekend for an athletic competition and stayed at this Marriott because of its proximity to the Convention Center. The Convention Center is about a block away. Well within walking distance. Checking in was a breeze. We arrived at about 4:30 on Friday and our room was ready when we got there. We asked for an upgrade to the concierge level, which was immediately granted because of our Elite Member status. The service at the hotel was very good. Everyone was pleasant and helpful from the front desk, to the bellhops, to the room service people. No issues whatsoever. Our room was extremely clean. No issues with mold in the bathroom, stains on the carpet, etc. Furniture was in good condition and the TV was a nice sized flat panel LCD TV. Beds were very comfortable (as always at Marriott). All the other typical amenities were present (as expected). Breakfast was included in our room rate and we ordered room service both days due to convenience. It was delivered hot and on time both occasions. Room service accidentally added these meals to our bill, but the front desk immediately fixed this once I brought it to their attention. The one complaint I read that was true was regarding the safe not working. We also experienced this and tried to have it fixed, but engineering never got to it. Apparently many of the rooms (ours not included) were having air conditioning issues. We found this out from an engineering department staff member we ran into in the hallway. This was not a huge concern. We just ended up carrying our limited valuables with us instead. The concierge helped us with reservations at a restaurant we wanted to go to and got us a free shuttle ride there. He also gave us one adult and one student ticket for their brand new Sports Hall of Fame near Camden Yards, for free. Parking in the garage was added to our room bill and worked out well for us since we were able to leave our car parked in the garage on Sunday well after we checked out, giving us time to still mill around the Inner Harbor without having to take the car and find new parking. Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor are withing walking distance. Camden Yards is a couple of blocks over. The concierge lounge at the Marriott used to have a great view over the stadium, but construction of a new Hilton is now blocking its view. The Inner Harbor and Aquarium are about 8 blocks away. About a 15-20 minute walk - not bad at all really. One restaurant I highly recommend going to is Roy's. It's on Harbor East and is well worth a visit. They serve Hawaiian fusion cuisine and are extremely kid friendly for the type of food they serve. Great sushi, great main courses. Get the pineapple upsidedown cake for dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Inner Harbor Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SandyT01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times for business. Overall, it's a pretty good hotel. It's very convenient to getting into and out of Baltimore. It's not super close to the inner Harbor though and there's definitely no view of the harbor. It is walkable, but I don't think I would walk alone in Baltimore at night. The convention center is right across the street. There's also a lot of construction going on both in the hotel and across the street, which can be noisy. The rooms are small, but mostly clean and the beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are fine too - except for the floors - covered in mold. I've stayed here a few times and in different rooms - all had moldy floors. So bring flip flops! The gym is nice for a hotel - clean and the equipment is good, including individual tvs on each piece of cardio equipment. The concierge lounge is also very nice and the free food is nice. The staff is also very nice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travels or non-tourists. For tourists and families, I would recommend staying closer to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit snobby and pricey”
Reviews.Author: PetefromRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel so that we could see a couple of ballgames with my 3 brothers.It seemed to be your typical Marriott.I always feel like the hotel staff is kind of snobby at the Marriott and almost like unless I'm in an Armani suit they won't take me serious.The hotel was clean and very nice but also kind of pricey even though the location was awesome for a baseball game.I'd probably stay again only for the location but as I said,for the price I think that I'd stay closer to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Abominable service”
Reviews.Author: CruisinChris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on business. At check-in I was greeted by a clerk who did not welcome me, did not acknowledge my Marriott Rewards status and was simply overall unhelpful, surly, and possibiliy uninformed. It was 1:00pm and my king room was not ready. I asked if some other accomodation could be identified as I needed to leave for work within the hour and would be working until late at night. I needed to get settled. No. Nothing. Nothing. No offer to even check. I returned to the desk within 2 minutes to confirm that they had my Rewards # (vaguely thinking that might make a difference). A different, older woman helped me and asked for my room #. I told her I didn't have one yet - and she looked at me with a very puzzled expression. She immediately offered my a double room, which I accepted and I was checked in in short order - with a welcome gift for Elite members. I was greeted as such as well and welcomed back. Night and day to the other gal. All I can think is that the first gal either needs re-training, doesn't care or some combination. The rooms - and the hotel overall for that matter - are VERY dated and in strong need of update. The room has wallpaper that I recall from Marriotts at least 10 years ago. When I returned to my room in the evening the TV remote was not functioning and a call to "At your service" to request help with the remote and order dinner - was another excursion into the land of indifference. The gal on the phone barely answered " At your Service" - the proper greeting would have included my name and a "good evening". I cheerily identified myself...no response...asked how this indiviual was ...What can I do for you? I told her I had several requests. I started with the remote...silence on the line...I said, So you'll be sending someone up...yes - you said you had several requests...Im waiting to hear the Rest!! yikes. I ordered dinner and a corkscrew. Dinner arrived very propmptly with a pleasant server - without a corkscrew. he returned promptly however and in the meantime the remote man arrived and solved the problem. Very hit and miss but my overall perception is that the staff are indifferent and the hotel is in need of revitalization. I don't doubt that will happen given the primo location and the new hilton going up across the street. This place is probably barely ok for a conference or a ball game but I wouldn't stay here again. The Hyatt I can see several blocks away make me regret my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Job!”
Reviews.Author: KevinOhio
Reviews.Content: This was great stay for my conference. "Slifke" (sorry if misspelled) from The Netherlands checked me in with a smile and greeting as well as efficient. The room was nice and they did a good job cleaning it daily. The location a block from the convention center was ideal. A block or 2 further was the harbor itself. Even at night I felt safe since there were security guards all over the place. The hotels main restaurant was expensive ("signature" Mac & Cheese for $24 - amazing) However I had a great reuben sandwich and fries right next door in the hotel for $11. Overall I was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; not really for families”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom_Bowie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take our two children - ages 7 and 1 - on a quick weekend getaway to spend quality family time. We decided on Baltimore because it's within an hour's drive from where we live and we didn't want to spend the weekend driving. We settled on the Marriott Camden Yards because it is close to the Inner Harbor (not on the water), I had stayed there previously for business and was impressed, and they had a great family special where all children's meals were included. Check-in was easy and they had fulfilled all requests we had made at the time of booking (mini-fridge for baby's milk). The rooms are becoming a little dated - peeling wallpaper, mold in the bathrooms - but it was otherwise clean. The beds in this hotel are the BEST! So soft and comfy... The hotel food was very good and room service was quick and responsive (although it seemed no one quite knew of the family package we were on). Our only complaint is that this hotel is for business travelers and conventions, primarily. There are no children's television stations (e.g., Disney Channel, Nick, etc.). They rushed us out of the lobby although my children were perfectly behaved. The pool is small - which is nice for kids - but as we were playing one evening, the lifeguard closed the pool (2 families were in the pool) so she could take a dinner break. I thought that was in poor taste... I highly recommend this hotel for business and conventions, not for families.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great exprience”
Reviews.Author: jforrest05
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We stayed at the hotel to see the Minnesota Twins play at Oriole Park the weekend of August 24th to August 26th. The hotel is one block from the stadium. The photos on the website are a bit misleading since you cannot see the stadium from the hotel as a Hilton is being built between the two. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping made our bed twice in one day while we were gone. Nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only problem we had during our stay was that when we got up early to leave the day of our departure we realized housekeeping had not replenished our towels or the coffee for the coffeemaker. I called the front desk and was told they would send someone up. When the person came he had towels but no coffee. I told him I asked for a coffee packet as well and he said he would get some. He never came back. Despite this, we were very happy with our stay and would stay again. Be sure to ask for specials when you call for reservations. When I called they quoted me the internet price of $199.00 a night. When I asked for any specials they said they had a getaway package for $149.00 per night and that included dinner each night. The food was great and in three nights my wife and I had $150.00 in our food bill taken care of. Big savings.

Reviews.Title: “completely ignorant staff, rude parking attendants”
Reviews.Author: sillysusan
Reviews.Content: i just returned from this hotel after a weekend stay for an engagement party. the front desk were all in training with no supervisor around. it took us about 40 minutes to check in due to the girl telling me if i use my debit/visa for incidentals the hotel withdraws all of my funds until i leave. then she can't figure out how to type in my credit card information. the room was ok. then we were given the wrong gift bag and told that it was the only one in the whole hotel and the girl at the front desk kept asking, "are you sure it's not yours?" uhhhh yeah...i don't know eric maharahji. however, the next day our correct gift bag was available and it had all the information in it we needed the night before. the parking lot was such a huge hassle. we were given a marriott hotel guest pass to leave the garage freely (and at $22/night you expect it to be relatively easy) but the card didn't work and the attendant kept us there for 45 minutes accusing us of trying to use different cards etc. and the whole thing didn't even make sense. we begged him to let us turn around and go back to the front desk to resolve the problem and he wouldn't let us finally letting us out b/c the traffic was backed up and we were now running extremely late to our party. the next day, went to the front desk to ask how to walk to the national aquarium - the girl at the front desk says, "i don't know what that is." we had to ask someone else. are you kidding me? it was a disaster. i would never go back here. the waitress at the whitecap tavern was unfriendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Comfortable Bed I've Ever Slept In!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. I was in Baltimore for a conference and I choose this hotel because of its proximity to the convention center and the Inner Harbor. Check in was a bit slow as there were several conferences in the city that weekend but the front desk staff was very friendly and gave me a pager that would let me know when my room was ready. I handed my luggage and laptop to the bellhop and he gave me a tag for the luggage and an orange security tag for my laptop. I was very impressed with that little detail, as it implied that they were taking some kind of responsibility for my laptop. I then left to find the Convention Center which turned out to be less than 2 blocks away. The Harbor is just a couple more blocks down Pratt. The location was absolutely perfect. After grabbing lunch at the Harbor, I walked back to check on my room although the pager had not yet gone off. It was 3pm and I had not expected to have to wait so long for my room since I had purchased a concierge level room. However, this was the only little complaint I have about the stay. My room was ready and the concierge had my luggage to me within 5 minutes. I then went up to my room. I was very impressed with the room overall. It was clean and smelled fresh, the bathroom was large and offer Aveda shower and bath products. The internet was easy to set up and reasonably priced at 10.00 per 24 hour period. The room was also very spacious but the deal sealer was the bed. The bed is a firm, yet pillowy mass of cool down comforters and great big fluffy/firm pillows that I sank into for a nap as soon as I put my bags down and surveyed the room. It was truly one of the best naps I've ever taken. And that night's sleep was even better. The hotel does offer a catalogue that sells their bedding and linens but it's way too expensive for me. I'll just wait for next year’s conference. All of the staff was very pleasant and helpful. I didn't get to try the continental breakfast offered in the concierge level lounge so I can't comment on that. In fact I can't comment on the food at all as I always ate out but the bartender was very nice in the lobby bar. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Great Free State of Maryland
Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: TomasCorona
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times as an Orioles fan and on past occasions it has been more than adequate. My most recent visit was unfortunately a bit of a disappointment. The room was very nice, the bed being the high point. Marriott bedding is truly beyond compare and one of the reasons we prefer Marriott. The room's floor, however, was filthy. I don't know whether the dark carpeting makes for less attention but though not immediately discernible to the naked eye, our socks showed proof of this after a relatively short amount of time. The bathroom was adequate, though nothing special. It was the little things that made this particular stay question staying here in the future. It started with not being recognized (as is usually the custom) at check-in as a Silver member. I don't need to be recognized as such for my own self-worth or anything like that, but it was just an interesting indicator of the level of attention to come. I had booked this stay as a "Romance Package" which included champagne and breakfast for two. The champagne never materialized, and breakfast was an adventure, to say the least. For starters, it was charged to my bill (despite the package) and only through haggling with the front desk was it taken off the bill. Secondly, the breakfast experience in Cafe Promenade has definitely gone downhill. A fork presented to me was filthy and when I complained it was handled nonchalantly. The buffet food is middling at best - though on previous trips, cooked-to-order items have been very good. I'm at a crossroads with this Marriott. I love staying there for the convenience to Camden Yards, not to mention the Marriott points, but the attention to detail was just not there like it has been in the past. It's still a serviceable place to spend the night, but the service itself needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: jehu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference which was held at the newer and "nicer" Waterfront property (but which was overbooked so the "overflow" was sent here). It is not convenient to the Inner Harbor area despite its name, and I was thankful for the shuttle service provided by the conference. The hotel IS very close to Camden Yards and the Convention Center. I had a King and my conference mates were in doubles. The rooms were large, up-to-date and very clean. The toiletries were the Bath & Bodyworks "Aromatherapy" brand. The showers were hot during the "peak" business hours of 6:30 to 8 AM, USA Today was delivered each AM at the door and complementary Wall Street Journals left on tables at the elevators (approximately 25 copies). The beds were VERY soft...too much so for my liking, so if you prefer firmness in a mattress you better ask whether they have any when you book (I have no idea whether they do, and the hotel was full so I didn't even bother to ask). It's clearly a matter of preference, however, since no-one else in my group complained The hotel itself is rather non-descript and boxy looking from the outside, there is no real lobby to speak of in terms of comfortable seating, and it is not special in any way. During Happy Hour the only evening we were in the bar, it was out of three draft beers for the two hours we were there. Don't know why, no explanations were given. We went elsewhere during our stay The conference price was $219.00 a room which I thought was very high for what I got (though mid-week Inner Harbor properties were going for $300 plus). In short the "Inner Harbor" is a very clean, serviceable hotel, and convenient if you were going to an Orioles game or attending an event at the Convention Center. You will be disappointed if you think it's on the harbor

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Florabora
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Marriott for 4 nights in March while my husband was at a conference. This was our first time traveling with our 5 month old son and thanks to the great customer service at Marriott, it went very smoothly. They brought up a small refrigerator and the crib (which was a travel crib, not a pack n play, and featured bumpers on the bottom - very sturdy) as soon as we checked in. The person who delievered them to our room noticed that the closet door wasn't on the tracks correctly and paged a maintenance man to come fix it asap - which he did within 10 minutes of getting paged. I did find our bed to be a little too soft. I stay at a Marriot in Atlanta quite frequently and liked their bed better - not sure why this hotel's beds were more soft. Another plus - there were 2 other conferences going on (and one of them were pre-teen cheerleaders) - and I didn't hear any noise from them at all from our room. We didn't try the pool, but we did use the restaurant/Cafe and were satisified with the quality/prices. The parking was very reasonably priced for Baltimore, too. The final bill was messed up slightly - due to us having booked the hotel via the conference program, but it only took them a few minutes to straighten out the bill. I found this hotel to be convenient to many tourist attractions and never felt threatened walking after dark to/from the inner harbor. Yes, there were some homeless people on the street, but you are in a big city - so I'm not sure where you'd go to avoid that. I had no problems pushing a 15 lb baby in a stroller from the hotel up to the Walter's art museum and back again, and I'm in no way in great shape.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the area, convenient, VERY clean”
Reviews.Author: NGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at a nearby hotel. Since the conference hotel had terrible reviews, I decided to make my own arrangements, and I am glad I did! The room was very clean, bed was made up with duvet/comforter, which is much more hygienic than the old fashioned never-gets-washed bedspreads most hotels have always used. I applaud hotels moving to the white European-style duvet/comforter, with the cover being washed daily. The Marriott Inner Harbor at Camden Yards was convenient, and not just for the ballpark. We walked to the conference hotel, walked to restaurants, shopping, and the inner harbor shops and museums (which is about a 15 minute leisurely walk. Definitely go to the lovely Aquarium (and book online to skip the lines! Include the dolphin show for a few bucks more.) Breakfast was not included in our rate and we tried room service which was very good but overpriced. We did dine in the pub (forget the name) inside the hotel, which was very reasonably priced for burgers and pizzas and some nicer dishes, and handy to have on-site. Did not find the area particularly seedy, but we're city people. Don't be fooled by what looks like a British pub across the street from the hotel: the Goddess is some kind of strip club! Still, it did not affect our comfort levels as we came and went in the evenings by foot. Parking is $18 a day but this seems like the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay if you are a baseball fan”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: I'm Marriott Platinum now...75 nights per year in Marriott so I get to know quite a few of their properties. This one is at or near the bottom. Let's get started.... Hotel Pool, freezing. Shower, Freezing. Restaurant, slow and food was cold (but not freezing). The place needs an extreme makeover. Probably last updated in the early 90's and plenty of brass and bad furniture. There is a Hilton being built next door which will likely block the view of the park from the upper floors, so it may remove the final reason to stay. I'm far from a hotel snob and would rather take a night without points at a Sheraton than stay here. Marriott...knock this bad 70's monument down and build a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: researcherNoVa
Reviews.Content: Clean room, nice people, perfect location.

HotelInfo.Name: Baltimore Marriott Inner Harbor at Camden Yards
HotelInfo.Address: 110 S Eutaw St, Baltimore, MD 21201
